item.title: Report X-2024100669
item.description:
Report X-2024100669

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BOX WAS DISCOVERED DURING THE UNLOAD PHASE TO BE LEAKING. IT WAS PLACED IN A SPILL TRAY IN THE DMP AREA. AFTER REFERENCING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. AFTER SPILL WAS ABSORBED, RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED THE AREA.

item.title: Report E-2024100229
item.description:
Report E-2024100229

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: LUMBERTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1242 ET, XPO-NLB notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately unknown amount of an Spectrum DT1402 product released from 55-gallon plastic drum due to shrink wrap to tight causing a pinhole puncture at the crease. The release impacted inside trailer#463-7525. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors overpacked the drum to (1) 65-gallon metal drum, product impacted and neutralized absorbents, soil and poly sheeting into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
